name: mcharmla liver
ingredients: 6 tomatoes (peeled and chopped into small pieces)
Juice of two lemons or a small glass of table vinegar
Spices: 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp cumin, 1 tsp ginger, pinch of pepper, salt
steps: Prepare the marinade: Chop the parsley, cilantro, and 1 garlic clove. Add the lemon juice/vinegar, paprika, cumin, ginger, pepper, and salt. Mix.
Cut the liver into large strips. Place them in the marinade and stir. Cover and refrigerate (at least two hours, ideally overnight).
Prepare the tomato sauce: Pour the olive oil into a large pan. Add the tomato pieces. Let reduce over medium heat (15 min).
Crush the remaining 3 garlic cloves and add them to the tomatoes. Add the remaining spices (paprika, cumin, ginger, pepper). Salt. Continue cooking until the sauce is well reduced and flavorful.
Fry the liver: Remove the liver from the fridge. Coat each piece with flour (optional). Heat the frying oil. Fry the liver pieces to sear and grill them (5 to 8 min on each side).
Cut the fried liver into large cubes. Add them to the pan containing the tomato sauce. Cook everything together for about ten minutes, stirring. If the sauce is too thick, add a bit of water.
Sprinkle with the remaining chopped cilantro and parsley. Serve hot.
